page.title: 07Education
page.content: The village school in Deene is now closed, but in the past it catered for the educational needs of children from Deene and Deenethorpe. Today there are few children in the locality, only five in Deene, and when they reach school age it is necessary to travel two miles north-east to the village of Bulwick. From this primary school they transfer to Kingscliffe Middle School, and then complete their education at Prince William School, in Oundle. In fact, during this study it was discovered that some parents in the district preferred the public school educational system, and sent their offspring to Stamford.
